Yes, using a disk as the pendulum bob could help reduce the effect of air resistance since the disk's shape remains constant, and there are no protrusions that could catch the air. Additionally, having a steel side and a wood side could help increase the density of the pendulum bob while keeping it lightweight, which could also help minimize the effect of air resistance.

However, keep in mind that the pendulum's motion could still be affected by air currents in the room or other external factors, so it's still a good idea to place the pendulum in a low-air-resistance environment if possible. Additionally, as I mentioned earlier, an offset center of gravity could affect the pendulum's motion, so you may need to carefully consider the placement of the center of gravity to ensure stable and consistent motion.
